text:
Hello all,
I'm building an email template and am trying to use a color field property in a custom module to set the color of an element in the template.
The HubL documentation for "Retrieving parameters from modules already rendered on the template" looks like you can access modules field's like so :
```{{ content.widgets.name_of_module.body.parameter }}```
However, in email development it looks like there's no developer info.

How can I access a color_field of a custom module to set the color of a seperate element in a template?

Thanks, any help is much appreciated!
Hi Gregory great question. To answer with the simplest method for you, can you tell me are you developing locally using the CLI, or using the Design Manager?
Hey Jon, I'm in the Design Manager.
Alright, thank you. The fastest/easiest method then is to go to the field in the module editor and click the copy> Copy snippet link that appears under the HubL variable name field

From there you can paste into your HTML and you will get the value you can use within your module.

If trying to use it outside of the module context you would access it like `{{ content.widgets.name_of_module.color_field_name.color }}`
Could you DM me the design manager URL for your module? I can take a look for you.
apologize for the delay, still looking into this. It may be the case that itâ€™s not possible to call the field outside the module in email templates.
